intro: Acisanthera bartlettii, commonly known as the Bartlett's acacia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant produces small, yellow, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Acisanthera bartlettii is adapted to survive in dry, hot environments, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers.
